mn55:1.2: Jīvaka was the Buddha’s doctor. His story is told in [pli-tv-kd8](), where we learn that he was raised by Prince Abhaya of Magadha, a Jain [mn58]() who was also interested in the teachings of  Pūraṇa Kassapa [sn46.56]().
mn55:3.2: This was an accusation made against the Buddha by Jains ([an8.12:31.2](), [pli-tv-kd6:31.13.1]()).
